title: Friday briefing : Switzerland advance in Euros and Arsenal sign Norgaard
body_text:
Fridayâ€™s briefing: Switzerland advance in Euros and Arsenal sign Norgaard
Euro 2025 hosts Switzerland snatched a dramatic 1-1 draw with Finland to book their place in the quarter-finals.
Arsenal completed the signing of Denmark midfielder Christian Norgaard from Brentford and Tottenham announced the arrival of Ghana forward Mohammed Kudus from West Ham.
Friday will see world champions Spain conclude their Euro 2025 Group B schedule against Italy, while Portugal take on Belgium, who are already eliminated.
Super sub Riola Xhemaili saves hosts
What a night for @nati_sfv_asf! ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡­#WEURO2025 pic.twitter.com/FVHsCCVtRi
â€” UEFA Women's EURO 2025 (@WEURO2025) July 10, 2025
Switzerland substitute Riola Xhemaili scored a dramatic stoppage-time equaliser to send the Euro 2025 hosts through to the quarter-finals after snatching a 1-1 draw with Finland at the Stade de Geneve.
Natalia Kuikkaâ€™s late penalty looked to have been enough for Finland â€“ who needed a win to progress â€“ to get out of Group A.
With 13 minutes left, Switzerland defender Viola Calligaris had made a rash challenge on Emma Koivisto, and Kuikka â€“ making a 101st appearance â€“ kept her composure from the spot to roll the ball down the middle.
However, Xhemailiâ€™s close-range finish in the second minute of added time sparked wild celebrations at the Stade de Geneve â€“ and around the rest of the country.
In Thursday nightâ€™s other match, Norway earned their third Group A win with a thrilling 4-3 victory over already-eliminated Iceland in Thun.
Christian Norgaard is a Gunner
ğŸ«¡ Leadership credentials âš½ï¸ Goal-scoring potential ğŸ¤ Big character
Everything you need to know about our latest summer signing, Christian NÃ¸rgaard ğŸ‘‡
â€” Arsenal (@Arsenal) July 10, 2025
Christian Norgaard admitted he thought his dream of playing for Arsenal had passed him by after completing his Â£10million switch from Brentford.
Denmark midfielder Norgaard, 31, made almost 200 appearances in six years with the Bees, helping Thomas Frankâ€™s side win promotion to the Premier League in 2021.
â€œOf course, there is always a little chance that a miracle could happen with Brentford, but it was probably unrealistic to play Champions League with them,â€ Norgaard said after becoming the Gunnersâ€™ third summer signing.
â€œNow, I get to hear the anthem and be a part of a Champions League campaign. It is a childhood dream and something I didnâ€™t think would be possible.â€
LJ is â€˜something specialâ€™ â€“ Lucy Bronze
England defender Lucy Bronze is convinced forward Lauren James can make an unparalleled contribution to Euro 2025 after her two goals inspired the Lionesses to a vital 4-0 victory over the Netherlands.
Chelsea forward James only returned from a three-month hamstring lay-off in late June but, moved out wide on Wednesday night, reminded everyone watching how capable a catalyst she is as the Lionesses bounced back from their opening defeat to France.
â€œWe know we just need to get LJ the ball in dangerous positions and there could be a goal from anything,â€ said Jamesâ€™ Chelsea team-mate Bronze.
â€œShe is probably the best player in this entire tournament for something special.â€
Olivia Smith set for milestone move
Arsenal are set to make Olivia Smith the first Â£1m player in the womenâ€™s game after agreeing a world-record fee with Liverpool.
The PA news agency understands a seven-figure deal has been accepted for the 20-year-old forward.
It is anticipated that Smithâ€™s move to Arsenal will eclipse Naomi Girmaâ€™s Â£900,000 switch to Chelsea from San Diego Wave in January.
Liverpool were reluctant to sell their player of the season, having only signed her last year from Sporting Lisbon, but felt Arsenalâ€™s offer was too good to turn down.
Smith now appears cleared to have her medical at Arsenal, who are believed to have seen off competition from a number of clubs for the forward â€“ including Womenâ€™s Super League champions Chelsea.
Kudus in, Gibbs-White set to follow
Our new #ï¸âƒ£2ï¸âƒ£0ï¸âƒ£ pic.twitter.com/DbRMj0ShZw
â€” Tottenham Hotspur (@SpursOfficial) July 10, 2025
Tottenham announced the signing of Ghana forward Mohammed Kudus from West Ham on Thursday night â€“ and look set to close in on a Â£60million deal for Nottingham Forest midfielder Morgan Gibbs-White.
Spurs are rebuilding under Thomas Frank and agreed what is understood to be a Â£55million deal for Kudus.
The 24-year-old leaves the Irons having made 80 appearances and scored 19 goals during a two-year spell after joining from Ajax.
â€œI have always wanted to play at the highest level,â€ Kudus said on the Tottenham website.
â€œHow big the club is, the history, and (in) the Champions League as well, so it is a big moment.â€
Nottingham Forest midfielder Gibbs-White is, meanwhile, set to have a medical at Tottenham ahead of a proposed Â£60m transfer.
Spurs have met the England internationalâ€™s release clause and a deal is accelerating at pace, the PA news agency understands.
Whatâ€™s on today

At Euro 2025, Spain will be looking to secure top spot in Group B when they take on Italy in Bern.
La Roja have already made sure of a place in the last eight with two impressive wins, while Italy can also qualify if they avoid defeat or Portugal fail to beat Belgium in Sion.
England and Wales are both holding media sessions ahead of their Group D clash in St Gallen on Sunday night.
Elsewhere, Chelsea continue their preparations in New Jersey ahead of the Club World Cup final against Paris St Germain.
